Texts.Chs: 这是我的礼物，希望你能享受它。
Texts.Eng: A gift of thanks, I hope you enjoy it!

Texts.Chs: 一餐无酒，一日无光。
Texts.Eng: A meal without wine is like a day without sunshine.

Texts.Chs: 他们已经逝去了吗？
Texts.Eng: Are they dead yet?
Are you trying to move a squatter in?
Are your kind acquainted with the fine art of brewing and distilling alcoholic beverages?

Texts.Chs: 搞快点，我还有一些东西在糖化桶里面呢！
Texts.Eng: Be quick with your business, I have something in the mashing tun!
Better be jocund with the fruitful grape, than sadden after none, or bitter fruit.
Burgundy makes you think of silly things, Bordeaux makes you talk of them and Champagne makes you do them.

Texts.Chs: 我能回来吗？我不得不在途中喝一杯。
Texts.Eng: Can I come back? I had to leave halfway through a drink.
Can you do something about the breaches in the walls? I can't let anything contaminate my brews.

Texts.Chs: 来，尝尝我的面包，喝喝我所酿造的酒！
Texts.Eng: Come try out my bread and drink the wine which I have brewed!
Concocting the ultimate bubbly is a great joy, if I dare say so myself.
Cou cou
Cura fugit multo diluiturque mero.

Texts.Chs: 你需要我吗，为了一个特别的理由？
Texts.Eng: Did you need me for a particular reason?

Texts.Chs: 你偷了什么东西吗？
Texts.Eng: Did you steal something?

Texts.Chs: 想要聊一聊天吗？
Texts.Eng: Did you want to chat?
Do I smell? Please let me know if I do, it could mean I botched the fermentation process again.
Drink! for you not know whence you came, nor why; drink! for you know not why you go, nor where.
Enough is enough. I deserve a better place than this

Texts.Chs: 收集美酒，夏日水果以及油，融入你的血管。，
Texts.Eng: Gather wine, summer fruits and oil, and put them in your vessels.
Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto those heavy of heart.

Texts.Chs: 好酒，好血。这是我奶奶告诉过我的。
Texts.Eng: Good wine, good blood - that's what my nan used to tell me.

Texts.Chs: 你好！
Texts.Eng: Greetings!

Texts.Chs: 我在这里！你想谈些什么呢？
Texts.Eng: Here I am! What did you want to talk about?

Texts.Chs: 这是礼物，谢谢你的帮助。
Texts.Eng: Here is a gift, for all your help.

Texts.Chs: 一切安好，我的朋友？
Texts.Eng: How are you my friend?
I bite like a serpent, and sting like an adder!
I can't put up with this much longer - look at the state of my brewery.
I didn't want it to come to this, but I can't stay here any longer.
I do have a cushy day job with lots of benefits and pay, but brewing and sampling fine wine and spirits is my hobby.

Texts.Chs: 我送了一件礼物给你，为了你为我做的一切。
Texts.Eng: I got you a present for all you've done for me.

Texts.Chs: 希望你能喜欢这件礼物，这是你所赢得的。
Texts.Eng: I hope you like the gift, you've earned it!

Texts.Chs: 我需要一个封闭的区域来酿造我的美酒。请帮我修复墙壁。
Texts.Eng: I need an enclosed area in order to brew. Please fix my walls.

Texts.Chs: 我需要你修理这个地方。这个地方酿造任何东西都不安全。
Texts.Eng: I need you to fix this place; it's not safe to brew anything here.
I rather like bad wine ... one gets so bored with good wine, especially if one is a chef.

Texts.Chs: 我看到那个了！
Texts.Eng: I saw that!
I see nothing about having too much wealth, if it gives me time to produce something that makes people happy and inebriated. Corporate social responsibility, right?

Texts.Chs: 我认为这个地方是我自己的家，而你却想我共享它？
Texts.Eng: I thought this place was my very own home, and you want me to share it?!

Texts.Chs: 哪儿凉快哪儿呆去。我的朋友可不好惹。
Texts.Eng: I urge you to return whatever you took. I have powerful friends.
I used to be a Protector, but then found my true calling - as a founding sole member of the Club of Extremely Inebriated and Erudite Gentlemen!

Texts.Chs: 我希望我的请求值得一听。
Texts.Eng: I wish my requests were listened to.
I'm coming to cut you down like John Barleycorn!

Texts.Chs: 我不会和另一个房客共享这块地方！
Texts.Eng: I'm not sharing this place with another tenant!
I've had a smack of every sort of wine, from humble port to Imperial Tokay.
If you stole something, beware, I am going to set your teeth on edge.

Texts.Chs: 酒后吐真言。
Texts.Eng: In vino veritas.

Texts.Chs: 它离开了吗？我的酒没事吧？
Texts.Eng: Is it gone? are my wines safe?

Texts.Chs: 现在安全了吗？
Texts.Eng: Is it safe now?
Is this a social call?
Just because I live amongst distilling equipment rather than dusty old antiques doesn't mean I'm poor. I'm a master brewer after all.
Let's break out the celebratory bubbly, I think we bagged them all.
My ancestors became rich and powerful by making fine liquors for a living. Me? I just live to sample them, I suppose.
My brewery efforts have been fantastic, and you ought to share in the rewards!
My peers oft indulge in pretensions of eruditeness by collecting crassly gilded ornamentations or wearing silly wigs, but I prefer to collect fine wines and fully aged spirits.
My people once had a saying: ''take wine in small doses, and knowledge in large ones''. But what about knowledge of wine?
My usually resilient patience is beginning to wear thin.

Texts.Chs: 不不不！
Texts.Eng: NoooOOOOooo!!!
Of course I'm rich! Just how many people do you think can afford to have the brewing equipment you see here?
Old wines to drink! old wood to burn! old books to read! old friends to trust! can anything else beat that?
Please spare me, I'm unarmed!
Remember - please consume alcohol responsibly, and don't drive while drunk!
Root pop? let me show you something better: it's red, bites like a serpent, and stings like an adder!
Take all the booze and cash I've got, just leave me alone!
Tell me what you drink, and I will tell you what you are.
That's for you to do as you please with.
That's it. I'm leaving. I can't stand working here anymore.
The fixes to these premises haven't been made.
This has gone too far, I need you to fix things!
This is beyond me. I'm taking my leave.
This is going very well! Here's a gift to say thank you.
Those holes in the walls need patching, I can't afford anything being blown in and contaminating my ingredients.
Voxels lose their value through inflation. Good vintage wines don't.
Welcome, welcome, welcome!
What contemptible scoundrel stole the cork from my lunch? was it you?
What is youth if not intoxication without wine?
When I drink a Claret my head spins, so from now on I'll drink Anjou or Arbois wine instead.

Texts.Chs: 酒水进，智慧出。
Texts.Eng: When the wine is in, the wit is out.
Where's a reinforced concrete winecellar when you need one?!?!
While you live, drink! - for, once dead, you never shall return.
Without that piece of equipment you took away, this place is worthless to me.
Won't you agree that the ability to brew and refine spirits is a mark of civilised living?
Yes, that woman in the floppy hat is my sister. Or was, until I disowned her for filling my vats with dross-quality lager.
You need me for something?
